bibl.title: Letter from Edwin Denby to Caroline Latimer, December 11, 1907

div1.p: Denby inquires about Kissinger's existing pension.

div1.head: Letter from Edwin Denby to Caroline Latimer, December 11, 1907
div1.opener:
House of Representatives U.S.
Washington,D.C.
December 11, 1907.
Miss Caroline Latimer,
1418 Eutaw Place,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Dear Madam:
div1.p:
I am in receipt of your letter of December 6th,
stating that you have ascertained that Mr. Kissinger, the
yellow fever sufferer, is now receiving a pension of $12.00
per month, the original application for $50.00 having been
allowed at that figure.

Will you please let me know whether or not this
pension is allowed by special act of Congress, or by the
Pension Bureau. If it is allowed by act of Congress no in-
crease can be secured.

closer.salute:
Awaiting an early reply, I am,
Yours very truly,
